plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After a full-scale mechanical overhaul, Mechanized Pumpkin was a fortress on wheels. Composite armor? Check. Iron reinforcements? Double check. Tactical interface? You bet. Everything was perfect... until he caught a glimpse of his reflection. A crab. They turned him into a crab. "Guys, seriously?! A little heads-up would've been nice!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pumpkin with many functions.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color>
<color=#8B0000>Metal Plant. Has a multitude of traits.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to Jack-in-the-Box explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Forces Digger Zombies to come out of the ground early.
<color=black>•</color> Halves damage from Cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Allows you to use Iron objects to regain Toughness.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers: </color><color=#8B0000>To Be Determined</color>

plants.name: Radiant Pot
plants.introduce: Deep in the garden, where the sun always shines, Radiant Pot stands in quiet devotion. He doesn't chatter, nor does he boast—he simply gives, weaving sunlight into golden coins, waiting patiently for you to grow as radiant as he is.
plants.info:
<size=36>Can quickly generate a lot of Sun and Coins.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits traits from Golden Pot. Produces 50 Sun and 300 Coins every n=(Current Sun/1000) Seconds, where 3 ≤ n ≤ 15.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Upgrade costs from Silver Pots to Golden Pots will not exceed 8000
2. Coins exceeding the maximum amount will be converted into Sun at a rate of 2:1</color>

plants.name: Pharos Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once the beloved director of the Plant Orphanage, she was more than just a caretaker—she was family. Her broad leaves were the perfect playground for young sprouts, offering shade, comfort, and joy. Though those days have passed, her kindness remains. "Oh? Would you like to try this marshmallow, my boy?" she asks, her warmth as enduring as ever.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots lasers to attack zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Energy Limit: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Search Range: </color><color=#8B0000>(2×Lumos Level+1) Rows</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> It has all the traits of Lumos Umbrella.
<color=black>•</color> Fires lasers to attack zombies, dealing 100% damage every second. Prioritizes air zombies, and deals ×3 damage to air targets. Can attack up to 4 zombies at a time.
<color=black>•</color> Every 2s, consumes up to 10% max energy to heal up to 2 injured plants in a 3×3 area for 5% max HP (max 500). Healing increases by 100% per Lumos Level beyond 1.
<color=black>•</color> When two Pharos Umbrellas are positioned one above and one below, they will link together, and their detection range will expand to cover the entire screen. In this state, the two Pharos Umbrellas can simultaneously attack up to 6 zombies, and their damage is doubled. Additionally, if exactly 6 zombies are being attacked, a 3×3 explosion will occur at the location of a random zombie every 6s, dealing 300% of the attack power as damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Energy Limit ×10 | Recovery Speed ×20 | Healing Speed ×2
2. Normal Attack Multiplier → 300% | Explosion Multiplier → 1000% | Attack Interval → 2s</color>

plants.name: Avarice-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"They told her not to open it. Naturally, she opened it." Avarice-shroom ran a finger along the ornate lid, gilded and humming faintly with temptation. Whispers spilled from within—hunger, envy, ambition—all begging to be set free. With a smile too knowing to be innocent, she lifted the seal. What emerged wasn't hope. It was profit. "Welcome, little monster," she whispered, as the abyss stirred and a new fortune clawed its way out.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>She can summon Mini-boss zombies!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable With Calamity-shroom's Modifier</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Calamity-shroom.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini-boss Zombie depending on the scene:
Day: Professor Cherryz | Night: Giga Football Striker | Pool: Jackson Worldwide | Fog: Skystrider Mecha | Roof Day: Pozeidon | Roof Dusk: Clown Jill-in-the-Box | Roof Night: Ultra Mecha-nut
<color=black>•</color> At the same time, summons its ordinary Odyssey variant on all rows.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating the Mini-boss Zombie gives you a ton of Sun, Coins, and points.
<color=black>•</color> Defeating an ordinary Odyssey variant gives you 1 Plant Giftbox.
<color=black>•</color> It can only be summoned once per round. This plant will not spawn from a Plant Giftbox.</color>

plants.name: Cherrybomber Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Originally developed as a rapid-fire prototype for the Gatling Cherrybomber, Cherrybomber Drone was recently upgraded to fire real cherry rounds to combat the zombie surge—earning explosive acclaim.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Provides enhanced firepower when coordinated with shooter plants directly below.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Gatling Cherrybomber</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Hovering plant and Subspecies of Gatling Cherrybomber.
<color=black>•</color> If the plant directly below attacks faster than every 1.5s, its attack synchronizes with that plant's.
<color=black>•</color> Maximum number of Cherrybomber Drones on the lawn: (number of lanes×2)</color>

plants.name: Napalm-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Napalm-Shroom isn’t just fire on the battlefield—his BBQ skills are legendary. His dream? To host the greatest barbecue party ever, with every plant and zombie in town invited.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs Napalm melons that split on impact and leave behind an inferno.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>3000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/7.5s + 30/0.02s (Inferno)</color>
<color=#720026>Enflamed Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000>Each melon creates an inferno zone that lasts for 2.5s.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Range: 4 tiles; Manual launch: full board. After launching a Napalm melon, rests for 1.5s, then charges up for at least 6 seconds, increasing damage to 1+(charge time in seconds×50%) to a max of 30s.
<color=black>•</color> Attacks pierce all armor and split into 2 additional Napalm melons that target nearby zombies with the same damage.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Charging speed and max charging duration ×3
2. Inferno zone duration ×2</color>

plants.name: Kelptain Goldbeard
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Since sailin' back from the battle o' Maelstrom Abyss, Kelptain Goldbeard be a changed beast — fiercer, greedier, and twice as hearted. Now, as captain o' the cursed Raiding Goldplant, bound by two hearts — one ripped from his own breast, t'other stolen from the fallen rival — Kelptain Goldbeard's fury rules the Seven Seas. Dare lay a hand on his hearts, and ye'll see yer own ship sink straight to Davy Jones' Locker, doom'd to perish 'neath the briny deep.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Greedy overlord of the seven seas, capable of squeezing every last drop of value from zombies.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40×3/1.5s + Insta-kill (Drown) × ∞</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Retains all traits of Hydra Kelp, but can drag zombies underwater an infinite amount of times (up to once per second).
<color=black>•</color> Zombies hit by its projectiles turn golden—when they die, they grant ×3 Odyssey points. Max bonus: +2000 points per wave.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Plants deal 5% more attack damage for every 1000 points owned (up to +300%)
2. The Odyssey shop now has a 30% discount on Modifiers</color>

plants.name: Buck-shroom Squad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Buck-shrooms' worst fear finally came true—they really did get stuck to a Magnet-shroom, and no one's been able to pull them off. But maybe it’s a blessing in disguise. With all the materials the Magnet-shroom collected, they've upgraded their gear and become a true "Steel Battalion."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A multi-purpose squad skilled in rapid fire, anti-air, and sniping!

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>6000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80×4/1 Second (Machine gun); 240/2 Seconds (Flak cannon); 400/3 Seconds (Sniper)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant. 
<color=black>•</color> Machine gun rounds knock back targets and deal additional damage based on the current HP of their Type 2 armor.
<color=black>•</color> The flak cannon targets only air units in its lane, dealing knockback and same-tile splash damage.
<color=black>•</color> The sniper attack shares the same traits as Snipea.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Sniper damage increased to 1,000,000, with a 1/3 chance to trigger rapid-fire snipes, but attack interval increased to 7.5 Seconds
2. Knockback distance and flak cannon splash damage ×3</color>

plants.name: Quantum McCornics
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He was born at the dawn of the universe, his age beyond reckoning. From the primordial void, he plucked three stars to orbit him as moons—treasures not even black holes could steal. Now, the old one finds joy in toying with this cosmic keepsake, as ancient as he is.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hurls ultra-dense black holes that collapse into explosions, releasing all the absorbed energy.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300/2 Seconds (Mini Butter)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Metal plant.
<color=black>•</color> 75% chance to launch Mini Butter, shrinking non-miniboss zombies' size and HP to 70%. If shrinking fails, the target is stunned for 1.5s. Instantly kills imp-class zombies.
<color=black>•</color> 25% chance to launch an Ultimate Black Hole that lasts 2s, slows nearby zombies, and absorbs Quantum McCornics' projectiles in a 3×3 area.
<color=black>•</color> Each bullet absorbed adds 2s to its duration, up to 7.5s. When it vanishes, it triggers a large explosion (Cherry Bomb-sized) that deals 320 + 60% of stored damage. If it lasted over 5s, the explosion radius significantly increases.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Ultimate Black Hole can absorb all projectiles
2. Ultimate Black Hole's absorption radius ×2</color>

plants.name: Tesla Magnet
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Tesla Magnet commands iron with thunder and thunder with magnetic fields. He grants his people eternal magnetism and built a kingdom of electricity. Yet beyond his military conquests and political achievements, he still suffers headaches in the search for a queen with the opposite charge.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Extremely magnetic, quickly absorbs metal objects and turns them into explosive cherries.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Lumos Magnet, metal object absorption CD: 0.5s.
<color=black>•</color> Can pull the pogo sticks from Clown-on-the-Pogo Zombies and convert them into Jack-in-the-Boxes; also pulls (insta-kills) Kirov Drones and converts them into Jack-in-the-Boxes.
<color=black>•</color> Deals 300 damage every 0.5s to 1 Giga Trident-nut Zombie or Giga Football-nut Zombie within range.
<color=black>•</color> Launches absorbed metal after 3s, dealing the same damage and AoE as explosive cherries; with full-map targeting and anti-air capability.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack Range ×2
2. Absorbs 3 Metal Objects at once, damage to Giga Trident-nut Zombies or Giga Football-nut Zombies ×3</color>

plants.name: Astro-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Astro-nut journeys through countless parallel worlds of the multiverse and has seen numerous wonders — from a Sphinx that plays eerie music in forgotten deserts, to a skybound ruin where a three-headed idol once stirred; from the glowing meteorites near the Tiberium shores to armored strongholds stamped with Z-Tech. He wanders through dreams, just beyond the grasp of memory. The past fades — but here, he's quite ready for another adventure.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cosmic Wall-nut with time rewinding and extraordinary invulnerability abilities.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Quantum McCornics</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>16000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Quantum McCornics, anti-crush and takes no more than 1000 damage per hit.
<color=black>•</color> Rewinds to HP from 3s ago after taking 4000 damage and becomes invulnerable for 2s.
<color=black>•</color> 33% chance to ignore incoming damage. Has a 25% chance to teleport biters to the rightmost tile in his lane (10s cooldown).
<color=black>•</color> If HP falls below toughness, restores HP equal to 1× Toughness after 30 consecutive seconds without taking damage.</color>

plants.name: Apeacalypse Railgun
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>He left behind the ceaseless minigun for a railgun that fires with precise, silent power—channeling electromagnetic force sharp enough to remind some of Academy City's famed Railgun and a certain relentless shooter cloaked in black.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Consumes HP to fire pulse rays with infinite penetration.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Apeacalypse Minigun</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×5/3s</color>
<color=black>Search Range: </color><color=#8B0000>±10° Horizontal Sector</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Apeacalypse Minigun, attacks pierce infinitely and can target air.
<color=black>•</color> If Toughness is greater than 500, each attack consumes 100 Toughness. Other plants cannot absorb damage for Apeacalypse Railgun.
<color=black>•</color> Attack power scales linearly as Toughness drops, up to a max of 900.</color>

plants.name: Boreal Lifereaver
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>At the heart of the tundra stands the Boreal Lifereaver, guardian of the frozen wilds. For years, it has endured unyielding winters, its branches heavy with frost, crowned with delicate lotus blooms. Even when playful newcomers etch runes across its bark, it remains steadfast and unshaken.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold gathers on spruce leaves, and lotuses bloom in the trees.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/0.02 Seconds (lasts 5 Seconds)</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom/blizzard respectively. Passively gains 1 ice charge every 5s.
<color=black>•</color> Fires a boreal reaper saw every 1.5s that turns into a homing shot on hit, with each instance of attack applying Deep Chill, adding 1 Cryo Point, and granting 1 ice charge.
<color=black>•</color> When ice charge exceeds 50, it depletes to 0 every 5s to heal all plants in a 3×3 area for (ice charge ÷ number of plants)×(0.3×shield + 0.7×HP).
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Boreal reaper saws now last for 15 Seconds
2. Healing is no longer split among plants</color>

plants.name: Infernal Sparkwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Infernal Sparkwood may burn brighter than any flame, but it was futuristic cuisine that truly lit up the competition. At the Culinary Clash's grand finale, he shared his trophy with Astro-nut, whose time-travel snacks left the judges starstruck. Even the judge McCornics called it "out of this world."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Torchwood blazing with Starfruit flames, boasting extreme ignition power and granting star projectiles homing capabilities.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Infernal Squashwood</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Infernal Squashwood.
<color=black>•</color> No longer spawns Spicy Squashes. Every 51 projectiles affected spawns a Spicy Starfruit in front.
<color=black>•</color> Ignites star projectiles (except spicy stars) for ×2 damage, but with original traits removed (except Magnetar stars), granting global homing with anti-air priority.
<color=black>•</color> Explosive cherries become Explod-o-Stars: ×2 damage, global homing with anti-air priority.
<color=black>•</color> Affects other projectiles like Infernal Squashwood. Triggers Jalapeno effect on death.</color>

plants.name: Atomheart Plantern
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The price of nuclear war isn't something just anyone can bear." A survivor of annihilation, Atomheart Plantern now chooses to restrain her core reactor, channeling its power into a glow as bright as the moon—guiding wanderers through the dark. But if anyone threatens the peace she holds dear… she won't hesitate to become the reaper of the battlefield once more.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Plantern sealed with radioactive frost, releasing cold fusion reactions that become stronger with Lumos.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Shroomageddon</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>600/3s</color>
<color=black>Range: </color><color=#8B0000>3×5, can target air</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Attacks apply Deep Chill and add 30 Cryo Points.
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Damage increases by 100% × Lumos level.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Shroomageddon. Switching form does not trigger on-death effects.
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits of Plantern.
<color=black>•</color> Refracts passing Apeacalypse Railgun beams into 3 beams with the same damage as the initial beam.
<color=black>•</color> On death, triggers Ice-shroom effect and grants 10 Lumos levels to all plants for 10s.</color>

plants.name: Radiant Pad
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Her devotion to the Sun God flows louder than a raging river. Radiant Pad was eventually dismissed from the Sun Guard for being way too noisy—but that hasn’t stopped her from preaching His glory to every creature beneath the waves. So deep in her zeal, she hasn’t noticed one thing: she’s been blocking all the sunlight from reaching the lakebed.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Golden Lily Pad that can quickly produce copious amounts of Sun and Coins.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection with Radiant Pot</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Produces 50 Sun and 300 Coins every n=(Current Sun/1000) Seconds, where 3 ≤ n ≤ 15.</color>

plants.name: Tyrannoflora Lux
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Tyrannoflora Lux wasn't sure how he ended up on land after a deep-sea haul, but he's made himself right at home. "Why go back to the sparse, dark depths when zombies are always on the menu?" he growls. Legend says his appetite is so huge, the gourmet contests could no longer afford their electric bill—guess he's their new emergency power source.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A giant chomper attracting zombies with light—a master of luring, devouring, and digesting.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>8000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>5 + (Sum Toughness of Zombies)^0.33s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Each Lumos level reduces digestion time by 10s to a minimum of 5s.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Anti-crush.
<color=black>•</color> Can swallow all non-miniboss zombies in a 1.5 tile range.
<color=black>•</color> Using a Chomper seed packet on it reduces digest time by 10s.
<color=black>•</color> Upon successful digestion, pulls nearby zombies from adjacent lanes to its lane and heals to full HP.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Attack range ×2
2. Provides 2 Lumos levels to a 5×5 area during digestion</color>

plants.name: Rot-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Big brother, big sister, am I not cute?" Rot-pult winks at every passerby. "Buy a garlic, please." He works hard at his sales pitch. Why would such a small child be out selling garlic? "Grandpa's movies are too boring, and our house is so full of garlic we can't even store it anymore," he explains.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lobs mini garlics, which split on impact, with a chance for rapid-fire or spread-fire.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Wither-pult</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/2s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Inherits rapid-fire and spread-fire chances from Wither-pult.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles no longer do splash damage, and splits into a mini-garlic-cabbage, a mini-garlic-kernel (1/4 chance for mini-garlic-butter) and a garlic-melon slice.
<color=black>•</color> These projectiles behave like their non-garlic mini counterparts (See Popcorn-pult, Slice-pult and Sprout-pult) and each grants 1 Poison point, boosting damage by (5×Poison points).</color>

plants.name: Vulcannon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Born from the fire that forged the stars, Vulcannon burns as creation once did — not to spread without end, but to end all things. When his final blaze fades, only the silence after the first spark will remain.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Launches cobs of pure lava and heat.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3600 (3×3)/36s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Infuses all plants in the blast area (3×3) with Cherry Bomb (prioritized)/Jalapeno (except Pumpkins and Flower Pots).
<color=black>•</color> Blasts inflict Enflamed Debuff and then does damage.
<color=black>•</color> Blasts split into multiple volcanic bombs on impact, the number increases with more zombies hit (at least 6). Volcanic bombs deal splash damage at half the power of the main blast.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Volcanic Bombs Damage ×5
2. Now triggers Thermonuclear Detonations when main blasts strike Cherry Bombs or Jalapenos (Cherry Bomb: Releases 10 Cherry Bomb effects in the surrounding area; Jalapeno: Releases 10 Jalapeno effects across the entire field. Each deals damage equal to (blast damage × 18))</color>

plants.name: Princess Solarnova
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Solarnova is princess of the Solaria Kingdom and a world-famous pop idol. Her hit single Dance of the Blazing Sun is so popular that even Dr. Edgar is rumored to own a copy. Despite her fame, she's approachable and loves meeting her subjects and fans, but just don't get too close, or her warmth might burn you.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates sun at extreme speed while melting down nearby projectiles. When active (eyes open), she unleashes searing solar flares; when inactive (winking), she stores radiant energy to be released later.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>50/3s</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Generates Sun and consumes nearby plant projectiles to absorb energy (1 damage = 1 energy). Energy is capped at Attack damage ×4; excess energy is converted to Sun (1 projectile = 5 Sun).
<color=black>•</color> When energy exceeds Attack damage, fires a solar shot that explodes on impact, dealing 100% Damage in a small area.
<color=black>•</color> Using a Coffee Bean toggles active/inactive modes. Does not attack in inactive mode.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. When a solar shot hits a zombie, it cause nearby projectiles to explode as well, dealing 10% attack damage
2. Energy cap ×3, Sun storage amount ×3</color>

plants.name: Selene Cabbage
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>She is the Moon Goddess, embodiment of calm and healing. Wherever her light falls, wounds quietly mend and all things are bathed in gentle restoration. Hanging high above the night sky, she balances yin and yang with tidal power, granting endless vitality.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Periodically summons mini-Moons to heal the battlefield. By the light of the Moon.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable with Helios Cabbage</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300×5/1.5s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000>Projectiles +100 Damage per Lumos Level (bonus damage up to +500).</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Subspecies of Helios Cabbage.
<color=black>•</color> Summons a Mini Moon every 30s. The Mini Moon lasts for 15s and heals all plants for 50×(number of Selene Cabbages on the lawn) HP per second. This effect is tripled on the plant with the lowest HP percentage.
<color=black>•</color> If a Mini Sun is also present, healing effects are doubled.
<color=black>•</color> The first Helios Cabbage Modifier increases Selene Cabbage damage bonus to +300 damage per Lumos Level, max damage cap → 1500; the second triples healing power.

<color=black>Magnetar Synergy Modifier:</color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> You must have unlocked all Magnetar and Helios Cabbage's modifiers before this synergy becomes available in the shop.
<color=black>•</color> With at least 10 Magnetars and 10 Selene Cabbages on the field, the Mini Moon from Selene Cabbage no longer disappears. Each Magnetar and Selene Cabbage channels a beam into the Mini Moon, which merges them into a single concentrated beam.
<color=black>•</color> Beam Damage: 100 × (channeling plants) every 0.02s, always locking onto the zombie with the highest max HP. Damage scales linearly over time when focusing a single target up to 5×.</color>

plants.name: Grim Arbiter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Grim Arbiter stands as judge at the end of all things. In his jaws every offering is measured: the unworthy are stripped away, the pure are given new form, and the balance is upheld without mercy; from his maw comes a verdict no soul can escape.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Click to channel destruction into rebirth for the plants ahead, while turning curses back upon their casters.

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Initial Selection</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>30s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Does not target zombies.
<color=black>•</color> If there is a plant in the tile in front, it is destroyed with a 50% chance to drop its seed packet. If the plant is cursed, the drop is guaranteed and the curse caster loses 15% max HP.</color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. Seed packet drop is now guaranteed
2. When destroying Odyssey plants with unbuffed on-death effects, the effect is amplified 4 times</color>

plants.name: Vortex Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black></color>
plants.info:
<size=36>

<color=#4A2900>Usage Condition: Odyssey Mode | Unlockable</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000></color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> 
<color=black>•</color> </color>
<color=black>Odyssey Modifiers:</color>
<color=#8B0000>1. 
2. </color>

plants.name: Spike-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spike-nut is always glaring, always frowning. "I need them to know I'm not a snack," he insists. The zombies, however, just laugh—because when has a Wall-nut ever been scary? Then they take a bite. Then they learn. The hard way.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spike-nut punctures the tires of approaching Zombonis!!

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Reflects 50 damage back to zombies biting it.
<color=black>•</color> Punctures incoming tires in exchange for 500 Toughness. It cannot protect against submarines or being stomped by Gargantuars.</color>

plants.name: Kraken-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sailors whisper of the Giant Kraken of the Northern Sea, its name alone enough to turn the bravest hearts cold. But Kraken-shroom? He's got no time for legends. He didn't come to terrify—he came to play. And his favorite game? Pushing zombies around like driftwood.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can repel zombies in front.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×2/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>1000</color>
<color=#006400>Tangled Debuff: </color><color=#8B0000> Adds 1 Tangle Value per hit, dealing additional damage based on the Tangle Value.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Repels approaching zombies (single target) and deals 100 damage.
plants.cost: <size=36>Fusion Formula: <color=#8B0000>Tangle Kelp ∞ [Sea-shroom] ∞ Tangle Kelp < Jicamagic (Place On Middle)</color>

plants.name: Frostburn-wood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"One input, one output. That's the rule." Frostburn-wood prided himself on his structured logic. "That's why I counteract Torchwood's flames with pure, unyielding frost." But put them together? Things got... messy. Fire and ice, heat and cold—sometimes they balanced, sometimes they clashed, and sometimes, well... physics just gave up.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Can turn normal peas into snow peas or polar ice peas, and water orbs into ice blocks.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Turns the normal peas that pass through into snow peas, and the snow peas that pass through into polar ice peas for ×2 damage and ×2 Cryo points.
<color=black>•</color> Turns the water orbs from Spruce Sprayshooters into ice blocks.</color>

plants.name: Twinkle-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Twinkle-shroom would be all over Dave's house, on the floor, on the table, on the dinner plate - Dave always forgot about the Doc's reminder - who cares, Daisy loved the gummy vitamins anyway!</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A small mushroom that shoots mini-stars.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/2.25 Seconds (Equivalent to the DPS of 10 Peashooters) </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).</color>

plants.name: Sunflower Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"What do you guys think 'flower pot' means, huh?" Sunflower Pot snapped. "Is it a pot for growing flowers? Or is it a pot that is a flower? Either way, let's get one thing straight—I am a flowerpot. End of discussion."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates extra Sun for you.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>15/25s</color>

plants.name: Lumos Umbrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Beyond the fog, she watches, a prophet untouched by mortal blindness. When God willed light into existence, she stepped forth. "By decree of the Almighty, I have come to the land of Seth. The fire looms, but with this sacred light, I shall protect the lost from its grasp."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>It can dispel fog and block bullets.

<color=black>Energy Limit: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Shield & Light Range: </color><color=#8B0000>3×3</color>
<color=black>Special: <color=#99582a>Lumos System</color></color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Provides 1 Lumos Level and dispels fog like a Plantern.
<color=black>•</color> Consumes Energy to block projectiles. Each block consumes Energy based on the damage of the projectile (excluding basketballs). Tridents cannot be blocked.
<color=black>•</color> Restores (25 x Lumos Level) Energy every second, pausing to rest for 5 seconds when it is completely exhausted.
<color=black>•</color> Reduces Energy first to absorb damage, where 5 Energy = 1 Toughness.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Thorn
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Umbrella Thorn just dropped his latest song, "Prickly Cactus." With a hopeful glint in his eyes, he mused, "Maybe one day, people will like me as much as they love roses. I know it won't happen overnight, but I'll keep trying my best."</color>
plants.info: <size=36>Can shoot down flying zombies and repel airships.

plants.name: Silver Sunflower
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Who says sunflowers only bask in the sun? Silver Sunflower has a knack for more than just growing—she's a master silversmith! With techniques passed down from her brewer, she forges dazzling silverware and jewelry, each piece shimmering with history. As they say, "A brewer's legacy lives on, and elegance never goes unnoticed."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates Sun faster.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/15s</color>

plants.name: Golden Sunflower
plants.introduce: Standing guard over a trophy had been so last season. Now? She was ready to shine—and not just under the sun. "Look, I love a good tan, but let's be real... I was made for the fight!"
plants.info:
<size=36>Generates Sun faster... faster!

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Every 10 seconds, 50 Sun is accumulated, up to 10,000.
<color=black>•</color> The Sun limit in the level is adjusted to 50,000.
<color=black>•</color> The excess will be stored in the available Golden Sunflowers.
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Costs 1000 Coins; makes all Golden Sunflowers release their stored Sun.</color>
plants.cost: <size=36>Upgrade Cost: </color><color=#8B0000>3000 Coins; each existing Golden Sunflower will double the cost</color>

plants.name: Frost Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Frost Wall-nut huffed as he hit the ground again. "Do the janitors ever remember to put up 'Caution: Slippery Floor' signs!?" he grumbled. But in his frustration, he failed to realize something very concerning—he was shrinking.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Zombies that bite him are slowed down.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies that chew it will be slowed down and will accrue Cryo points. Frost Wall-nuts can be upgraded to Frost Tall-nuts using a Fertilizer.</color>

plants.name: Pumpkin Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Once a chip shop owner, Pumpkin Mine had a simple business model: cut the fries in half but keep the price the same. The customers disagreed. Now in the Garden, he's offering a different kind of deal—one that ends with a bang. Yet, for some reason, people still bring up his old menu.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A shorter Pumpkin.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles). However, non-"short" plants inside it will be hit. Each time it is damaged, a small explosion will occur, causing 500 points of damage to zombies.</color>

plants.name: Doom Cactus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom Cactus is a firm believer in the Art of War of Plants: bide your time, strike hard, and leave nothing standing. Whether it's zombies shambling through the battlefield or armored rats scurrying for cover, one well-placed explosion is all it takes to turn the tide.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires destructive thorns.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each attack has a 0% starting chance of unleashing an Ultimate attack. If it fails, the chance is increased by 5% for the next attack.</color>
<color=black>Ultimate: </color><color=#8B0000>Shoots a large number of thorns forward, which can hit airborne units.</color>

plants.name: Doom Chomper
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>In the Chomper's Big Eater Championship, Doom Chomper was a force to be reckoned with—until he took things a little too far. "He didn't just eat his cake—he incinerated mine!" a fellow contestant recalled. Unsurprisingly, he was disqualified for excessive destruction.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Devours a zombie to produce a Doom explosion.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>60s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Each time it successfully bites a zombie, a Doom-shroom explosion is released, causing a crater to appear in front of it (does not trigger explosion if in the rightmost column).</color>

plants.name: Flame-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>As the head chef of the restaurant, performing a fiery dragon dance on the teppan is a must-have show for every dinner. But every time, at least one guest ends up getting burned. Word has it that to make up for it, the Flame-shroom gave them an encore performance.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Flamethrower incarnated.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>33/1.5s (Piercing)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals fire damage and inflicts Enflamed debuff. Flame-shrooms can be upgraded to Flame Gloom-shrooms using a Fertilizer.</color>

plants.name: Doom Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom Pea and Frenzy-shroom are great friends—one's a hothead, the other’s laid-back. But together, they're the perfect pair. "We may be opposites, but we bring out the best in each other."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A damage-scaling Peashooter and the perfect partner for Frenzy-shroom.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>40/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks penetrate Type 2 armor. Damage increases by 1 each attack, up to 60. If a Frenzy-shroom is planted 1 tile behind it, Doom Pea gains Frenzy-shroom's attack speed and Frenzy-shroom gains Doom Pea's attack damage.</color>

plants.name: Lumos Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The Lumos Pot always emits a warm glow, so it is often used as a nightlight. If you look closely, you will also find a small inscription on the edge of the pot that says, "Firefly habitat, please do not disturb."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Flower Pot that can be used as a small Plantern, providing 1 Lumos level for its tile.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Dispels a small patch of fog, providing 1 Lumos level for its tile.</color>

plants.name: Spring Melon
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Holding your breath, focusing, and striking with precision!" Spring Melon is very patient, always waiting for the perfect moment to make a move. If you ask him how he manages to stay calm, he will always mention his mentor, Imitater.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A big shroom with coiling vines that lob watermelons after charging.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>120/4s</color>
<color=black>Range:</color><color=#8B0000> 4 tiles ahead</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Charges when not attacking for at least 4.5s to increase damage to (1 + charge time × 0.5) times the base damage. Maximum charge time: 30s.</color>

plants.name: Sparkwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After graduating from university, Sparkwood returned to the mountainous region to teach. "From the moment I received an education, I understood that knowledge is meant to be passed on like a 'spark'!" The flame of knowledge ignited the students' enthusiasm and also the zombies.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Torchwood shaped like a Starfruit, ignites star projectiles.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Ignites passing star-shaped projectiles (except thorn stars and jack-in-the-box stars), adding 20 damage and removing their other traits. Ignited stars do splash damage in a similar way to ignited peas.</color>

plants.name: Spicy Starfruit
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spicy Starfruit silently glares, while the other starfruits keep their distance: "He looks too scary." But Spicy Starfruit doesn't care; he is focused on creating an ultimate piece of art. He firmly believes that when he finally blooms, everyone will take notice.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Explodes and releases high-damage spicy stars.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>100 × 25</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not trigger the Jalapeno effect Immediately when fused. Explodes instead 1 second after fusion, releasing Jalapeno effect and exploding into 25 spicy stars.</color>

plants.name: Doomwood
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Whenever someone asks Doomwood, "What's the secret to grilling?" he just silently collects and repurposes the embers. It's not that he's indifferent; if he spoke, you'd just end up with a face full of ash.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doomwood keeps burning even after a Doom-shroom explosion and it takes burning to the next level.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> When its Ember value is 0, it behaves the same as Torchwood.
<color=black>•</color> When the Ember value is not 0, turns peas and regular ignited peas into ember peas, with +30 damage and a no falloff 1/3 splash damage. Ember peas inflict the Ember debuff.
<color=black>•</color> Can also use 10 Ember values to strengthen Doom peas or Mini Doom-shroom projectiles, ×2 or ×6 their damage respectively, and to enhance their splash effect to be the same as the large bullet of doom.</color>
<color=#7303fc>Ember value: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Initial: 60, Maximum: 60, 1 point is lost per second.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 60 points for every 60 projectiles ignited, 30 points when affected by Doom-shroom explosions, and 10 points when any zombie within a 5×5 area dies with the Ember debuff. 
<color=black>•</color> Ember debuff will be cleared by cold/frozen/poisoned status and coexists with the Enflamed debuff.</color>

plants.name: Scareless Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Trust me, it's very safe inside." Scareless Pumpkin gently reassures Scaredy-shroom, as the built-in phonograph and fairy tale books help them no longer worry about the zombie horde.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pumpkin with the color of the Scaredy-shroom. Scaredy plants inside the pumpkin will not be afraid.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Scaredy plants inside the pumpkin will not be afraid (Frenzy-shroom and Gatling Frenzy-shroom will not self-destruct).</color>

plants.name: Starry-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Guys in the distance, no matter who you are, except for the circus people, don't come over!" The Starry-shroom, trembled, "I, I am very powerful!" He kept attacking, thinking that this would scare off those with ill intentions, but he didn't notice that his bullets weren't even hitting straight ahead.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Starry-shroom shoots stars faster and in 5 directions, but also gets frightened more often.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20×5/0.75s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks in the same way as Starfruit, but becomes afraid if there is a zombie in its range.</color>

plants.name: Squash Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Squash Pumpkin has never met a match in arm wrestling, has diligently learned various techniques for skipping stones, and is very good at selecting stones—his only bane is that he is very afraid of water and can only watch others skip stones.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The cozy nest of Squashes. When there are specific plants in the shell, it can spawn squashes.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>225</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Squash plants in Squash Pumpkins lose their ability to detect enemies.
<color=black>•</color> When there are Squash or Squashwood plants in Squash Pumpkin, a baby squash with 1/8 damage (minimum 225) and a maximum jump distance of 1.5 Tiles is spawned. It disappears after 6 jumps and regenerates after 3 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Baby squashes spawned from Infernal Squashwood releases the Jalapeno effect when it lands.
<color=black>•</color> Abilities do not work in water lanes.</color>

plants.name: Popcorn-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The results of this experiment: dense planting is not conducive to plant growth, and the corn ears have obviously shrunk." Dave bent down, took out a magnifying glass, and looked at the Popcorn-pult, "Not suitable for making corn rolls anymore." Popcorn-pult said angrily, "The results of this experiment show that the concentrated ones are all the essence!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A tiny Kernel-pult, with a chance to throw a small butter that shrinks zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Short plant. Has a 25% chance to throw a small butter that deals 40 damage, which shrinks the size and health of non-shrunken zombies by a factor of 0.7, otherwise it will be stunned for 1.5 seconds, while Imps are killed instantly. Prioritizes zombies that are not shrunken.</color>

plants.name: Hoverleaf
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After resigning, Hoverleaf embarked on a journey around the world. "Sailing with the wind to the places your heart desires, isn't that very romantic?" He compiled his experiences into a book, which received praise from all walks of life.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A smaller floating Umbrella Leaf that can only protect the 1 Tile below.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. He shares the same traits as Umbrella Leaf, but can only protect the plant right below it.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Pumpkin
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Many plants were curious about how Hypno Pumpkin had only subdued one zombie. "I'm a dedicated person, so of course I need a dedicated zombie," Hypno Pumpkin said, scratching his head.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Hypno Pumpkin makes a hypnotized zombie stay by your side.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 4% chance to hypnotize zombies eating him. Forces up to 1 hypnotized zombie to stay in his tile, and uses that zombie as a shield first when under attack.</color>

plants.name: Umbrella Shell
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Umbrella Shell is the trendiest hairstylist in the garden, known for its ability to create cool hairstyles on hard nut shells. Although the lifespan of this hairstyle is short, it doesn't stop people from loving it—and the opening of the sixth nut hair salon chain.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Umbrella Shell has the traits of both his fusion ingredients.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has the characteristics of Umbrella Leaf and Wall-nut. Can repel approaching zombies, dealing 40 damage every time.</color>

plants.name: Bombrella
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Bombrella has changed to a new hairstyle, making it look even more rebellious and irritable, like a delinquent wandering the streets. But don't be fooled by its appearance; it actually has a soft heart and even helps the barber clean up the fallen leaves.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>When repelling, it causes small-scale cherry explosions, and harnesses the power of cherry explosions to protect surrounding plants.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>600</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits the traits of Umbrella Leaf.
<color=black>•</color> Repel approaching zombies and release a small-range cherry explosion with a damage of 300. 
<color=black>•</color> Immune to explosive basketballs.
<color=black>•</color> For every instance of Cherry-fused defensive plants or Cherry Pot healing through cherry explosions in the surrounding 3×3 area, it gains 1 level of energy, up to 100 level. 
<color=black>•</color> Bombrella uses 2 levels to absorb any damage in the surrounding 3×3 area.</color>

plants.name: Chrono Pea
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Nothing has been born earlier than the universe, and nothing will perish slower than the universe. But for life, his/her body is not as enduring as the death of a star; his/her spirit is even more eternal than the universe. Cherish the present, seize the future, even if it's just for a day or two, that is still a mayfly's life." — "Chronicles"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Peashooter with the power to warp space and time, firing neutron peas that inflict the Chronoshift effect, erasing every trace of the target from the time continuum.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks deal no damage but apply Chronoshift for 1.5s, or extend the duration by 1 second if the target is already affected. Deals only 100 damage to Mini-bosses.</color>
<color=#00008B>Chronoshift: </color><color=#8B0000>Zombies under this effect receive a countdown of (HP / 30) seconds, after which they are instantly erased. If the effect ends early, they take 30 × (elapsed seconds) points worth of damage.</color>

plants.name: Kernel Morph
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"The elderly also need to learn to keep up with the times," the Kernel Morph said, "This new force of magnetism has truly opened my eyes." Of course, there is a small problem; it always makes the neighbors think he's a scrap collector.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>The Kernel Morph can fuse with metal objects and changes into the corresponding form based on the type.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>60/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Has a 25% chance to throw a magnetic butter with 80 damage, and stuns the target for 4 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Portal-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"You've seen Interstellar, right?" Portal-pult often brings up his favorite sci-fi movie. "The male protagonist drives into a cornfield at the beginning and then pilots a spaceship into a black hole at the end. There must be some connection between the two!" Portal-pult insists.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Portal-pult has a chance to throw a neutron butter that generates a mini black hole.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Has a 25% chance to throw a neutron butter with 100 damage, which generates a mini black hole when it hits. The mini black hole massively slows zombies down and explodes after 2 seconds, causing 100 damage and reducing the countdown of zombies with the chronoshift effect by 30 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Bolt-pult
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Bolt-pult has been considering buying some anti-rust paint lately, as his butter always ends up with a bit of a rusty taste, which seriously hinders his ability to make butter cakes for his brothers. "Butter with a rusty taste might only be good for fighting zombies."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Bolt-pult throws Iron kernels or Iron butter that is miraculously effective against Type 1 armor.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>2000</color>
<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Metal plant. Has a 25% chance to throw an Iron butter with 100 damage, which stuns the target for 4 seconds and removes their Type 1 armor instantly.</color>

plants.name: Frozen Cherry
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>The plants all say that Frozen Cherry is calm, introverted, and taciturn. "I occasionally confide in the other cherries," Frozen Cherry said, "they call it 'explosive news.'"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cherry mold made of ice, he absorbs cherry projectiles from plants to generate Cherry Bomb seed packets.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Absorbing cherries, ignited cherries, and explosive cherries grants 1, 2, and 10 energy points respectively. For every 100 energy points collected, a Cherry Bomb seed packet is generated. Upon death, unleashes a Cherry Bomb explosion and freezes all zombies in its range for 10 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Dormant-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Using magnetism to confine nuclear energy is a topic that Dormant-shroom has been researching for a long time. This is a difficult task, and timing is crucial; numerous laboratories of his are now in ruins. However, it seems that the zombies are more eager for him to succeed than the plants.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Dormant-shroom is stabilized by magnetic force and can be fused with metal to transform into a corresponding form.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Does not explode until further fusion.</color>

plants.name: Doomwarp-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Time travel personnel have passed through, complete. The time tunnel has exited the target world, complete. Observed impact is within the expected range, complete. Proceed to the next step, destroy the tunnel to prevent use by others or organizations." — "Time Planning Bureau"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doomwarp-shroom possesses the power of hyperspace bending. Its explosion inflicts chronoshift to any foe unfortunate enough to be caught in its effects.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800 (Cremator) </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Doom-shroom. Explosion reduces the countdown of zombies with the Chronoshift effect by 30s.</color>

plants.name: Chrono-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Other plants often hear Chrono-nut recount the mysteries on his adventures — like a Sphinx with a zombie’s head, a minivan that only beeps, and the 1001 kinds of machines developed by GFishtus Corps.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A Wall-nut with spacetime powers. He has a chance to teleport back attackers and can rewind health once when near death.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> 25% chance to teleport biters to the far right of the same row (10s cooldown).
<color=black>•</color> When taking lethal damage, rewinds HP to what it was 3s ago and becomes invulnerable for 3s (single use ability).</color>

plants.name: Pea Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pea Drone sees himself as the future of garden warfare. "Support-type aerial drones — a weapon of a new era." Unfortunately, he has little time to promote his ideas — he works three jobs to pay off his soilless cultivation loan.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A peashooter drone that enhances firepower when coordinating with straight-shooting plants below.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hovering plant. If the shooter directly beneath it attacks faster than once every 1.5 seconds, Pea Drone syncs its attack rate to match.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Sawshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>In the snowy plains, it’s said that the taller the Christmas tree, the happier the next year will be. So who can place the star on top? That's a job for the Spruce Sawshooter and his unmatched aim.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires piercing saws that leave spinning spruce needles on zombies.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3 Seconds; 1×75/1.5 Seconds (Spinning spruce needle)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
<color=black>•</color> Projectiles pierce once (including ice blocks) and leave spinning spruce needles on the first zombie hit.
<color=black>•</color> Spinning needles deal 1 damage every 0.02 seconds for 1.5 seconds.</color>

plants.name: Soak-me-not
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>After equipping a high-pressure water jet, Soak-me-not greatly improved her cutting efficiency. But there's one downside — flowing water is hard to come by on the snowy plains.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Cold-resistant, deals more damage when it's sufficiently cold and applies chill when there are ice charges.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>8/0.02s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charge when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> With ice charges, attacks deal double damage, inflict Deep Chill and add 1 Cryo Point, but have an 1/9 chance to use up a charge. </color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Sprayshooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Can an archer compete without a bow? Spruce Sprayshooter shrugs: "It's just waterbending."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Bends and shoots water orbs; consumes ice charges to launch ice blocks instead.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>50/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Uses 1 ice charge to shoot an ice block with double the damage that inflicts Deep Chill and adds 40 Cryo points, dealing ×4 damage to Frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Supershooter
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spruce Supershooter is stern, cold, and strict—perfect traits for a top-tier coach.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Shoots spinning hydro-needles that cling to zombies. Consumes ice charges to shoot spinning cryo-needles instead.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>5×75/1.5s</color>
<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Spinning hydro-needles deal 5 damage per 0.02 seconds and last 1.5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Uses 1 ice charge to shoot spinning cryo-needles with double the damage that inflict Deep Chill and adds 1 Cryo points, dealing ×4 damage to Frozen zombies.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Snowbloom Spruce
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"People talk about iron trees blooming or old trees flowering," Snowbloom Spruce murmurs. "But I’m neither iron nor old. I just... never mind." He stops talking to admire his blossoms.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spruce with snow lotus blooms and a reduced cost for healing nearby plants.

<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 ice charge passively every 10 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/blizzard respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Awakens at 5 charges, firing an ice orb that deals 100 damage with 3×3 splash (no falloff) and inflicts Deep Chill.
<color=black>•</color> While awake, consumes 1 charge per sec to heal a 3×3 area by 50 HP. Returns to sleep when charge is exhausted.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Shield Lotus
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Her bunny ears are so cute!" "She’s adorable even when asleep!" "Like a rose!" Shield Lotus sleepily swats away the fans that lack a sense of personal space—yes, she's thorny like a rose, but that hasn’t stopped the admiration.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A steel-leaved Lotus that heals nearby plants and gives them shields.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits Snow Lotus traits. Healing also grants 50 points of Shield to each plant. See Saw-me-not for shield mechanic explanation.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spruce Firnace always carries dry spruce leaves. He claims they're excellent "green" fuel—flammable and easy to collect. Right now, he's sun-drying a batch.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Spruce Sharpshooter, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 210s.</color>

plants.name: Saw Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Using potassium as fuel not only provides ample heat, but also gives off beautiful flame colors," Saw Firnace enthusiastically explains. "And this fan, modified from a circular saw, helps blow hot air right to you." As a top employee of the snowfield sauna, he's always committed to providing the best service.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Saw-me-not, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 120s.</color>

plants.name: Lotus Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I was born extraordinary," claims Lotus Firnace. He thinks he glows from phosphorus fire — but actually, it’s just fireflies hiding from the cold inside him.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Snow Lotus, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 60s.</color>

plants.name: Aloe Firnace
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Aloe Firnace has upgraded its air system to better regulate temperature in small areas. The only problem: the water dripping from the condenser tends to freeze quickly in the snowfield.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>An upgraded Firnace that absorbed Aloe Aqua, with an expanded protection range.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Inherits the traits of Firnace but with range expanded to 3×3. Reverts to regular Firnace after 90s.</color>

plants.name: Aloe Alba
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doctor Aloe Alba is the most beloved young doctor in the hospital. It's not just due to his diligence and skill — it might also be his mustache-like leaves. After all, patients tend to trust older-looking doctors.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Throws aloe extract upwards; upon falling, it heals surrounding plants and temporarily boosts their attack speed.

<color=#0077b6>Cryo System: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1 ice charge passively every 5 seconds.
<color=black>•</color> Gains 1/1/15/60 ice charges when affected by snowball/snow trident/Ice-shroom/blizzard respectively.
<color=black>•</color> Every 5 seconds, consumes 5 charges to heal all plants in a 3×3 area for 50 HP and boost their attack speed by 30% for 5 seconds.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.</color>

plants.name: Icy Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>To tame its hot temper, Icy Squash locked itself in the freezer for three days and nights. Now it keeps the mood ice-cold — so cold that the other plants don't dare say a word to 'set it off.' As for zombies… let's just say, no one's allowed to 'break the ice' with it.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squash imbued with freezing power.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon landing deals 600 damage to zombies in a 3×3 area and freezes them for 4s.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Squash
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"I've finally realized zombies really are our friends,"said Hypno Squash, who quickly joined the Zombie Buddy Club. The only problem: his extremely radical way of showing friendship turned all the other members into conservative ones.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Squash that overwhelms zombies with charm.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Hypnotizes the zombies he crushes, deals 1800 damage instead if the zombie cannot be hypnotized.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Garlic
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Garlic doesn't quite fit in with the rest of the garlic family — he's far too popular for that. Loved and envied by his kin, he pays them no mind. All he wants is to pull his hat low over his eyes and enjoy a peaceful nap whenever he can.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Garlic with a shroomy hypno-cap mushroom on its head.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Causes hypnotized zombies that touch him to switch lanes.
<color=black>•</color> When bitten, hypnotizes the attacker, forces it to switch lanes, then reverts to a regular Garlic.</color>

plants.name: Hypno Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Hypno Mine isn't one for rushing. It believes every zombie deserves a second chance — preferably before it explodes. Contradictory? Maybe. But it's perfectly in line with its five personal principles, which it refuses to share.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mine with an explosive charm.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>1800</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Hypnotizes the zombies exploded, deals 1800 damage instead if the zombie cannot be hypnotized.</color>

plants.name: Tangle Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Originally a naval mine tossed ashore by a powerful tsunami, this fella now lies half-buried in the soil. Though the kelp outside has withered, the explosives inside remain deadly.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Potato Mine tangled with kelp.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> When armed, insta-kills the first approaching zombie and triggers a Potato Mine explosion.</color>

plants.name: Kelp Mine
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Beware, ships — reefs ahead!" Tangle Mine serves as the river's safety officer, signaling danger with a red light. He does a solid job, since wherever he appears, danger is never far behind.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Tangle Kelp that's as explosive as Potato Mine.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Drown)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Insta-kills the first approaching zombie and deals 600 damage to zombies in a 3×3 area.</color>

plants.name: Firnurse
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Firnurse brings warmth and life to the frozen wilderness. Despite his odd appearance, the local kids adore him. "Sugar cube, anyone?" he offers cheerfully. "Helps keep the heat in!"</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Stable high-temp Firnace that periodically provides charges or healing to nearby plants.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Inherits traits of Firnace, with a 3×3 protection range.
<color=black>•</color> Cannot be placed near other Firnaces.
<color=black>•</color> Provides 1 ice charge to protected Snow plants every 3s.
<color=black>•</color> Heals protected plants for 50 HP every 15s.</color>

plants.name: Flame Wall-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Always wear a smile"—that’s rule number one for Flame Wall-nut, the ever-patient restaurant server. Even when half-melted Frost Wall-nut is slipping all over the floor yelling about the lack of a 'Wet Floor' sign, he just keeps smiling. And sizzling.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spicy-flavored nut that scorches biters.

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Deals 20 damage to biters and inflicts Enflamed debuff. Flame Wall-nuts can be upgraded to Flame Tall-nuts using a Fertilizer.</color>

plants.name: Doom-nut
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Doom-nut is a huge fan of Batman. He rarely speaks, preferring to lurk in shadows, and only shows up at the occasional Comic-cons. One time, he startled McCornics in a hallway. "When did Doom-shroom get... this bulky?" the old corn muttered.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Wall-nut with nuclear potential. 

<color=black>Toughness: </color><color=#8B0000>4000</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to non-physical explosions. 
<color=black>•</color> Prevents Doom-shroom Zombies in a 3×3 area from exploding. 
<color=black>•</color> Heals for 100 HP when a zombie with Ember debuff dies in a 5×5 area.
<color=black>•</color> Triggers Doom-shroom effect on death.</color>

plants.name: Spike-kelp
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Spike-Kelp always felt like the runt of the spikeweed family—small, unnoticeable, and half-submerged. The others tried to cheer him up: "Hey, at least you're still more popular than that prickly old Spike-nut."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikeweed but aquatic and tangly.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks add 1 Tangle Value. Takes 10 damage every time he attacks a vehicle.</color>

plants.name: Tangle Weed
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Founder of the now-famous aquatic foot massage empire, Tangle Weed has redefined spa therapy. With branches in every biome and a new line of vehicular massage lanes, business is booming—especially with traffic this bad.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Spikeweed that tangles zombies even on land.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>20/1s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Attacks add 1 land Tangle Value (1/3 the efficacy of aquatic Tangle Value).</color>

plants.name: Doomplate-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Boom! A reality-defying burst of high-speed nuclear fission tears zombies apart, breaking down their atoms and rearranging them into the most stable form known to plantkind: iron. "Why iron buckets?" Doomplate-shroom pauses, then replies, "Because I was born that way."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Powerful Doom-shroom that turns the ashes from his explosion into Buckets.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3240 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every zombie he kills drops a Bucket.</color>

plants.name: Threetato Mine
plants.introduce:
<align=justified><size=36><color=black>Threetato Mine loves playing tricks underground. It shoots out surprises not once, not twice, but thrice—like a cheeky prankster with a never-ending stash of boom. Watch your step, or you might get a triple whammy that’ll blow your boots off.

- Written by Mrs. Draco</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Threetato Mine resurfaces after exploding and fires potatoes across three lanes.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>30×3/1.5s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Short plant (evades straight-firing projectiles).
<color=black>•</color> Attacks faster as zombies get closer (down to 0.5s per attack).
<color=black>•</color> When armed, explodes on contact, dealing 5400 damage, knocks back for 1 tile and retreats into the ground.
<color=black>•</color> Re-emerges 15s after exploding. Explodes and disappears immediately upon contact with vehicles.</color>

plants.name: Lumos Angler
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>They say Lumos Angler has never gone hungry—not once. Every chomp lands a juicy zombie. He even published a book sharing his secrets: "Wiggle... wiggle... zombies love a gentle glow." — From his work Lantern.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Lures in zombies to snack on with his lophos.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>Insta-kill (Devour)</color>
<color=black>Digestion Time: </color><color=#8B0000>40s</color>
<color=#99582a>Lumos System: </color><color=#8B0000> Each Lumos level reduces digestion time by 10s to a minimum of 10s.</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Upon successful digestion, pulls a nearby zombie from adjacent lanes to its lane.</color>

plants.name: Doombox-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>"Hey clowny!" the zombies jeer. Doombox-shroom just glances their way in silence. He doesn’t need to argue: his masterpiece will speak for itself. Too bad none of them will be around to see how it ends.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Doom-shroom with enhanced explosive powers able to cause chain explosions.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>3240 (Cremator)</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>For every zombie eliminated, creates a Jack-in-the-Box explosion that deals 1800 damage at its position.</color>

plants.name: Cherry Pot
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherry Pot would rather give up her pay at the Zen Garden than be mistaken for a plant."Those lunatics can't get real cherries, so they're out here trying to eat anything cherry-flavored!" Just talking about it makes her shudder.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A pot with a passion for cherry explosions, using them to heal the plant on her own tile and briefly empower cherry-type shooters.

<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Immune to cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> Heals the plant on herself by 20 HP when affected by cherry explosions.
<color=black>•</color> While healing, also grants an 1-second attack speed boost (30%) to cherry shooting plants.</color>

plants.name: Cherry Drone
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Cherry Drone always cares about appearances—whether or not anyone's watching. Ground or air, if you mess up his hair, you’ll get blasted. Hard.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A cheeky cherry delinquent that floats through the air and dive-bombs zombies in style.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>300</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>Every 15s, targets one zombie in a 3×5 area and dive-bombs them, causing a cherry-style explosion in a 1-tile radius.</color>

plants.name: Sunrise-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>A seasoned sunlight banker, Sunrise-shroom offers high interest on your deposits."You chose a time deposit," he says sternly to a frustrated Twin Solar-nut. "Withdrawals aren't allowed just yet."</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A visionary sun producer that absorbs and multiplies nearby sun, paying out in bursts.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/20s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Absorbs dropped Sun within a 5×5 area, multiplies their value by ×1.3, and stores them.
<color=black>•</color> Releases as much Sun as possible in batches of 25 along with the next production.</color>

plants.name: Sunny-shroom
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Sunny-shroom's been working on a new breathing method to quickly vent all that awful sunlight. But… "Ahh! Zombies!!" And just like that, he's curled up, trembling, forgetting everything. As for the breathing method? He'll figure it out when the zombies walk away.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>A timid sun producer that tries to work faster until it panics.

<color=black>Sun Output: </color><color=#8B0000>25/25s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Production interval gradually shortens to 10s.
<color=black>•</color> Cowers in fear when zombies approach, resetting interval back to 25s and producing 25 Sun immediately.</color>

plants.name: Spruce Ballista
plants.introduce: <align=justified><size=36><color=black>Pulling a giant ballista is exhausting, so even Spruce Ballista needs a vacation. Thanks to Astro-nut's help, he found a job in another world: Helping to launch angry avians at some very green, very smug pigs.</color>
plants.info:
<size=36>Fires giant spruce bolts that pierce through zombies and detonate with a short delay.

<color=black>Damage: </color><color=#8B0000>80/3s</color>
<color=black>Special: </color><color=#8B0000>
<color=black>•</color> Must be planted on two side-by-side Spruce Sharpshooters.
<color=black>•</color> Immune to freeze from Snowballs and Blizzards.
